title: Uploading files/directories with more that 255 characters in the name to crypted dropbox remote fails
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Uploading files/directories with more that 255 characters in the name to dropbox fails 

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone version
rclone v1.53.3
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.15.5

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
Ubuntu 18.04 64bit

####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
Dropbox with crypt

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone -v --progress copy "gdrivecryptnocache:data/" "dropboxcrypt:data/"

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
2020-11-25 11:17:09 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/10 (error path/malformed_path/...)
2020-11-25 11:17:09 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 20ms
2020-11-25 11:17:10 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 2/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/...)
2020-11-25 11:17:10 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 40ms
2020-11-25 11:17:10 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 3/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/..)
2020-11-25 11:17:10 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 80ms
2020-11-25 11:17:11 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 4/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/.)
2020-11-25 11:17:11 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 160ms
2020-11-25 11:17:12 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 5/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/.)
2020-11-25 11:17:12 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 320ms
2020-11-25 11:17:13 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 6/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/..)
2020-11-25 11:17:13 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 640ms
2020-11-25 11:17:14 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 7/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/...)
2020-11-25 11:17:14 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 1.28s
2020-11-25 11:17:15 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 8/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/)
2020-11-25 11:17:15 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 2s
2020-11-25 11:17:16 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 9/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/...)
2020-11-25 11:17:18 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 10/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/...)
2020-11-25 11:17:18 DEBUG : Avatar- The Last Airbender/Season 3/Avatar- The Last Airbender - 3x18-19-20-21 - Sozin's Comet- The Phoenix King + Sozin's Comet- The Old Masters + Sozin's Comet- Into the Inferno + Sozin's Comet- Avatar Aang/Avatar-.The.Last.Airbender.s03e18-19-20-21.Bluray-1080p-CiNEFiLE.mkv: Received error: upload failed: lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/... - low level retry 1/10
2020-11-25 11:17:19 DEBUG : : Uploading chunk 1/187
2020-11-25 11:17:23 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 1.5s
2020-11-25 11:17:23 DEBUG : : Uploading chunk 2/187
2020-11-25 11:17:26 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 1.125s
2020-11-25 11:17:26 DEBUG : : Uploading chunk 3/187
2020-11-25 11:17:28 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 843.75ms
2020-11-25 11:17:28 DEBUG : : Uploading chunk 4/187

Annoyingly while doing this in a copy rclone attempts to upload the long file several times before failing out meaning if the file is large the copy can take an excessive amount of time trying to upload a file that will never ever upload to the dropbox remote.

Not sure what the best fix is, and if crypt is causing some obfuscation on the error or not? It seems like truncating long files means the remotes wont match if used for a restore, and not copying large files means you might loose something important.
